result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travion Omarion Jordan

records.addlTxt:
Scheduling Conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Travion Omarion Jordan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William F Sulton appeared by video for Travion Omarion Jordan.  Attorney Careen Gordon appears in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective D. Bettin. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Travion Omarion Jordan not in court, in custody.  Attorney William F Sulton not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Sulton failed to appear. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Travion Omarion Jordan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney William F Sulton in Court for Travion Omarion Jordan.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court DENIED Defense counsel's Motion to Modify Bail. Court found GOOD CAUSE to TOLL TIME LIMITS. Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Travion Omarion Jordan appeared by video.  Attorney William F Sulton in court in person for Travion Omarion Jordan.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel requests a Preliminary Hearing date. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility. Defense Counsel requests to be heard on bail.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

-received and filed. 
Attorney William F. Sulton

Adjustment Number: 22A 084988,
Payable Number: 1030295,
Receipt Number: 22RP035717,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Travion Omarion Jordan not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Travion Omarion Jordan in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Travion Omarion Jordan in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Travion Omarion Jordan appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
